channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2740] C'mon, Google, who are you kidding? (PIC)
item.description: He said as he planned a surprise all over his keyboard.

item.title: [+2046] Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it
item.description: Anyone else starting to feel like this again?

item.title: [+1678] Creepy twist at the end of Back to the Future 3
item.description: It looks like Doc Brown's son has ideas for the future.

item.title: [+1627] Stewart Skullf#@ks Blogosphere
item.description: Last night, Jon Stewart, er, called out the blogosphere for using overblown adjectives to describe his segments: "If you just followed this show on the blogs, you would think I was running around town cutting people from scrotum to sternum, wearing their skin as a trophy."

item.title: [+1314] Grade for Common Sense: F-
item.description: On Monday, a teacher caught a 12-year-old doodling on her desk with a lime green magic marker. Instead of just erasing it, the school called police and the girl was walked out in handcuffs. Give me a break! What's next? Will spitballs bring an assault charge? Could kids get 7-to-10 for shooting rubber bands? Grownups can be idiots.

item.title: [+1193] Amazing Frozen Waterfall (PIC)
[+1086] 16 panda cubs pose for cutest class shot... Ever (PICS)
item.description: Posing for their first day at their new nursery, these 16 panda cubs are clearly going to be a handful. In these amazing images, the tiny pandas are shown their new home for the first time after being separated from their mothers.

item.title: [+1064] The FBI Wants To Log Everything You Do Online
item.description: The FBI is putting the pressure on ISPs to keep logs of what user do online, and then to keep these records for at least two years. FBI Director Robert Mueller is calling for the retention of user “origin and destination information.”

item.title: [+891] The last thing the US post office needs
[+760] What You Could Buy for the Cost of a Super Bowl Ad (Graphic)
[+699] 27 Avatar Questions, Answered By The Movie's Designers
item.description: Avatar's designers explain how the spaceship ISV VentureStar flies, how the Na'Vi hair-braids connect to the planet and so much more. "Jim has always talked about a fractal layer of detail, where as you get closer to the world of Pandora, more and more levels of intricacy emerge to create a sense of reality..."

item.title: [+688] The FBI Wants Our Web Browsing Activity: Fair or Foul?
item.description: FBI Director Robert Mueller wants ISPs to track “origin and destination information” about their customers’ browsing habits and store them for authorities’ use for two years. What do you think, should ISPs acquiesce?

item.title: [+642] Palin's campaign against the "R-word" hits snag
item.description: Sarah Palin's campaign against the derogatory usage of the word "retard" collided with her campaign to maintain her popularity with conservatives today, with confusing results.

item.title: [+619] Please control your emotions! [Video]
item.description: AccuWeather.com forecast video for the coming Snowpocalypse. This is no joke, people!

item.title: [+605] James Cameron Pissed About Avatar Actors Oscars Snub
item.description: “People confuse what we have done with animation,” director James Cameron said at the recent Producers Guild Awards. “It’s nothing like animation. The creator here is the actor, not the unseen hand of an animator.”

item.title: [+602] Microsoft warns of IE flaw, turns PC into public file server
item.description: Microsoft has warned of an Information Disclosure vulnerability discovered in Internet Explorer. Windows XP users on IE6 or users who have disabled Internet Explorer Protected Mode are affected.

item.title: [+599] Sen. Franken to Comcast & NBC: merger no laughing matter
item.description: Pretty much everything about cable, video, and the Internet came up at yesterday's Congressional hearings on the proposed Comcast/NBC Universal merger. Even former NBC star Al Franken got into the fight. Plus there was a skirmish over the great Boxee/Hulu war. We've got the details.

item.title: [+596] You're almost there pal...
[+542] When 70% Support Marijuana Legalization, Starbucks Gets Msg
item.description: A pro-cannabis group based in Colorado called for a nationwide boycott of coffee giant Starbucks after activists spotted a Starbucks logo on the website of a virulently extremist anti-drug organization. After intense negative publicity ensued, Starbucks issue a denial.

item.title: [+522] How Not to Right An Overturned Semi Truck (Video)
item.description: We've all seen semi trucks turned turtle on the freeway before, but as it turns out, the cleanup aftermath of a rollover can be as action-packed as the initial calamity. Said another way, If we ever run into an overturned hauler on a dangerous stretch of mountain road in Chile, we now at least know what not to do.
